isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - TROUBLESHOOTING - TROUBLESHOOTING TEST CHARTS

svcsubproc.title: TCM Power and Ground Circuits
svcsubproc.para: Problems with the TCM Power and Ground circuits can be due to missing ignition voltage, missing battery voltage, open fuses, or open/shorted wiring.

entry.para: Disconnect TCM gray vehicle connector (3031) and install breakout box J 43799. Turn key on. At cavity 4, measure voltage from circuit 104 to ground. At cavity 2, measure voltage from circuit 102 to ground.
(3031), cavity 4, 104 to gnd.; cavity 2, 102 to gnd.
Locate cause of incorrect ignition voltage to TCM. (Refer to the applicable circuit diagram for fuses and circuits involved.) Go to next step.
AT TCM gray vehicle connector (3031), cavity 3, measure voltage from circuit 103 to ground.
Locate cause of incorrect battery voltage to TCM. (Refer to the applicable circuit diagram for fuses and circuits involved.) Go to next step.
At TCM gray vehicle connector (3031), cavity 3, measure voltage from circuit 103 to cavity 5, circuit 105 and cavity 1, circuit 101.
Locate open in circuit 105, 101 or 11-G to battery ground.
TCM power and ground circuits check good. Reconnect connector (3031).

svcsubproc.title: J1939 Data Link
svcsubproc.para: Problems communicating on the data link can be due to problems with the service tool and software, bad connections, defective "Y" connectors, missing or defective termination resistors, open/shorted wires or, faulty electronic modules attached to the data link.

entry.para: Connect the EZ-Tech or other service tool running the TransPro software to the (9-pin) diagnostic connector. Turn key to ignition position. Is the TransPro software able to communicate with the TCM?
Commun- ication on J1939 estab- lished.
TransPro software and J1939 are function- ing correctly.
Verify the service tool and TransPro software are working correctly by testing them on another vehicle. Go to next step.
Physically verify there are no crossed circuits.
CAN-H not connected to CAN-L or CAN-S circuits, etc.
With ignition off, disconnect TCM gray vehicle connector (3031) and engine controller connector (379).
Install breakout box J 43799 on gray connector (3031). Measure the resistance between cavity 32 and 39 of connector (3031).
J1939 circuits check good. Go to step 8.
Disconnect the two 120 ohm terminating resistors from connectors (3084A) and (3084B). Measure the resistance across each resistor.
Measure the resistance between connector (3031), cavity 32 and ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit CAN-L.
Measure the resistance between connector (3031), cavity 29 and ground.
Reinstall resistors. Go to next step.
Locate short to ground in circuit CAN-H1.
Measure the resistance between cavity 32 and 29 of connector (3031).
Locate open in circuit CAN-H, CAN-H1, CAN-L, CAN-L1, or "Y" connectors.
Measure resistance between connector (3031) circuit 31 and ground.
Locate open in circuit CAN-S or CAN-S1.
Measure the resistance between cavity D and C of diagnostic connector (384).
Remove breakout box and recon- nect all con- nectors. Go to next step.
Locate open circuit between connector (384) and Y-splice (3084C).
J1939 circuits check good. Turn ignition on and attempt to communicate with the TCM.
Disconnect the engine controller from the data link. Attempt to communicate with the TCM.
Refer to the engine manual regarding ECM replace- ment.
Refer to the Allison troubleshooting manual regarding TCM replacement.

svcsubproc.title: Neutral Start Circuits
svcsubproc.para: Problems with the Neutral Start circuits could be due to misalignment of the NSBU, defective switches in the NSBU, or open/shorted wires.

entry.para: Disconnect clutch switch connector (386). Turn key on and shift transmission to neutral. At cavity C, measure voltage from circuit 97AU, to ground.
Disconnect NSBU connector (3026). Turn key on. At cavity E, measure voltage from circuit 97P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97P, then repair.
Shift transmission to neutral. Measure resistance between pins E and G on the NSBU.
Pins E and G on the NSBU.
Check adjustment of the NSBU. Replace if necessary.
Disconnect clutch switch connector (386). At connector (3026), cavity G measure resistance from circuit 97AU to ground.
Re- connect (3026). Go to next step.
Locate short to ground in circuit 97AU, then repair.
Turn key on and shift transmission to neutral. At clutch switch connector (386), cavity C measure voltage from circuit 97AU to ground.
Re- connect (386). Go to next step.
Locate open in circuit 97AU between NSBU connector and connector (386).
Transmission neutral circuits check good. Check remaining cranking system circuits for cause of problem.

svcsubproc.title: Back-Up Light Circuits
svcsubproc.para: Problems with the Back-Up Light circuitry could be due to misalignment of the NSBU, defective switches in the NSBU, or open/shorted wires.

entry.para: Disconnect back up light switch connector (304). Turn key on and shift transmission to reverse. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit 71A to ground.
Disconnect NSBU connector (3026). Turn key on. At cavity C, measure voltage from circuit 71 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71, then repair.
Shift transmission to reverse. Measure resistance between pins C and F on the NSBU.
Pins C and F on the NSBU.
Check adjustment of the NSBU. Replace if necessary.
Disconnect back up light switch connector (304). At connector (3026), cavity F measure resistance from circuit 71A to ground.
Re- con nect (3026). Go to next step.
Locate short to ground in circuit 71A, then repair.
Turn key on and shift transmission to reverse. At back up light switch connector (304), cavity B measure voltage from circuit 71A to ground.
Re- connect (304). Go to next step.
Locate open in circuit 71A between NSBU connector and connector (304).
Transmission back up light circuits check good. Check remaining back up light system circuits for cause of problem.

svcsubproc.title: CHECK TRANSMISSION Light Circuitry
svcsubproc.para: Problems with the Check Transmission circuitry could be due to errors in the TCM, a burned out bulb, or open/shorted wires.

entry.para: Disconnect gray TCM connector (3031) and install breakout box J 43799. Measure resistance from pin 25, circuit 125 to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 125.
Use a test jumper to connect (3031), pin 25, circuit 125 to ground. Turn key switch to ignition position.
Loosen cluster and remove transmission warning light bulb. Test bulb for continuity.
Re- install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect instrument cluster connector (26). With jumper still attached at connector (3031), measure resistance from connector (26), circuit 92 to ground.
Locate open in circuit 92, then repair.
Disconnect instrument cluster connector (26). Turn key on. At cavity 1, measure voltage from circuit 28A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 28A to instrument cluster, then repair.
With jumper still connected, reconnect (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect all connectors.

svcsubproc.title: Range Inhibit Light Circuitry
svcsubproc.para: Problems with the range inhibit light circuitry could be due to errors in the TCM, a burned out bulb, or open/shorted wires.

entry.para: Disconnect gray TCM connector (3031) and install breakout box J 43799. Turn key switch to ignition position. Measure voltage from cavity 23, circuit 123 to ground.
Remove range inhibit light lens and remove bulb. Check range inhibited lamp for continuity.
Re- install bulb and lens. Go to next step.
At TCM connector (3031) measure resistance from cavity 23, circuit 123 to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 123, 13MA, and 13M.
Disconnect (3044). Turn key to ignition position. Measure voltage between range inhibit light connector (3044) cavity A and ground.
Re- con nect (3044). Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage through circuit 13MA, circuit 13M or fuse (3039).
Turn key switch to ignition position. Measure voltage from cavity 23, circuit 123 to ground.
Locate open in circuit 123, then repair.
Range inhibit light circuits check good.
Refer to the Allison troubleshooting manual regarding TCM replacement.

svcsubproc.title: Mode Select Circuitry
svcsubproc.para: Problems with the mode select circuitry could be due to a defective switch, a burned out bulb or open/shorted wires.

entry.para: Disconnect mode select switch connector (3043). Push switch to the on position. Check mode select light for continuity by measuring resistance between cavity B and cavity A.
(3043) between cavity B and cavity A.
With mode switch pushed in, measure resistance between cavity D and cavity C.
(3043) between cavity D and cavity C.
Turn key to ignition position. Measure voltage between mode switch harness connector (3043) pin A, circuit 13MG and ground.
(3043) between pin A, circuit 13MG and gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage through circuit 13MG, circuit 13M or fuse (3039).
Measure resistance between mode switch harness connector (3043) pin B, circuit 94-G and ground.
Locate open in circuit 94-G, then repair.
Measure resistance between mode switch harness connector (3043) pin C, circuit 110 and ground.
Re- con nect (3043). Go to next step.
Locate short to ground in circuit 110, then repair.
Disconnect gray TCM connector (3031) and install breakout box J 43799. With mode switch pushed in, measure resistance between cavity 28, circuit 128 and ground.
Locate open in circuit 128D, then repair.
Refer to the Allison troubleshooting manual regarding TCM replacement.

svcsubproc.title: Torque Convertor Lock Drop for ABS System

note.para: If the torque convertor lock or exhaust brake activates during an ABS stop, or the transmission will not lock, verify the ABS circuits are working properly before troubleshooting transmission circuits.

svcsubproc.para: Problems with the torque convertor lock in relation to the ABS can be due to a missing signal from the ABS controller to the ABS signal relay, a defective ABS signal relay, or open/shorted circuits between the relay and the TCM.
This troubleshooting chart only covers the ABS signal relay and the circuits between the TCM and the ABS signal ground relay.

table.title: Torque Convertor Lock Drop for ABS System

entry.para: Remove ABS signal ground relay (3038). Turn key switch to ignition position. Measure the voltage between cavity 2 of the socket, circuit 13ME and ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13ME, then repair.
Bench test ABS signal ground relay (3038) by measuring the resistance between pin 30 and 87A.
Bench test ABS signal ground relay (3038) by measuring the resistance between pin 30 and 87, while applying 12 volts to pin 86 and ground to pin 85.
Disconnect gray TCM connector (3031) and install breakout box J 43799. Measure resistance from cavity 25, circuit 113 to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 113, then repair.
Insert a jumper between cavities 3 and 4 of the ABS signal ground relay (3038) socket. Measure resistance between TCM connector (3031) cavity 13, circuit 113 and cavity 28, circuit 128.
Locate open in circuit 113 or 128, then repair.
ABS signal ground relay and circuits to the TCM check good. Re-install all connectors and relays.
If no other source for the problem can be found, refer to the Allison troubleshooting manual regarding TCM replacement.

svcsubproc.title: Speedometer Signal
svcsubproc.para: Problems with the speedometer signal can be due to no output from the TCM or an open/shorted circuit between the TCM and the engine controller. Other possible causes not related to the transmission are defective engine controller, data link problems between the engine controller and the instrument cluster or a defective instrument cluster.

entry.para: Disconnect engine ECM connector (379) and install breakout box ZTSE-4445. Disconnect gray TCM connector (3031) and install breakout box J 43799. Measure resistance between (3031), cavity 26, circuit 126 and ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 126, 126A, 126B or 47, then repair.
Insert a jumper between connector (379), CAVITY 39 and ground. Measuring the resistance between (3031), cavity 26, circuit 126 and ground.
Remove jumper and Re- connect (379) and (3031). Go to next step.
Locate open in circuit 126, 126A or 47, then repair.
Disconnect speedometer sensor connector (303). With a tire spinning measure the voltage between pin A, from the TCM, to ground.
(303) pin A, from the TCM, to gnd.
No signal out of TCM. Check programming. TCM may need replaced.
Vehicle speed signal and circuits from TCM to engine ECM check good. Troubleshoot ECM and speedometer.

svcsubproc.title: Differential Lock Circuits
svcsubproc.para: Problems with the differential lock circuits can be due to an open fuse (225), no output from the TCM to energize the locking differential relay, a defective relay, or open/shorted wires in the circuits. If no problems are found in the circuits on this chart the problem may be in the air system from the differential lock select lever and the differential.

entry.para: Remove locking differential relay (494). Turn key switch to ignition position. Measure the voltage between cavity 2 of the socket, circuit 13Y and ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage through circuit 13Y, inline 20 amp fuse (225) and circuit 13Z. Repair condition.
Bench test locking differential relay (494) by measuring the resistance between pin 30 and 87A.
Bench test locking differential relay (494) by measuring the resistance between pin 30 and 87, while applying 12 volts to pin 86 and ground to pin 85.
Disconnect gray TCM connector (3031) and install breakout box J 43799. Measure resistance from cavity 22, circuit 122 to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 122, then repair.
Insert a jumper between cavities 1 and 3 of locking differential relay (494) socket. Turn key to ignition position. Measure voltage between TCM connector (3031) cavity 22, circuit 122 and ground.
Locate open in circuit 167 or 122, then repair.
Measure voltage between locking differential relay (494) socket cavities 2 and 1.
Locate open in circuit 13X, then repair.
Measure resistance between differential relay (494) socket cavity 3 and ground.
Check for open or short to ground in circuit 49C, differential lock solenoid (226) or circuit 11-G.
Locking differential relay and circuits to the TCM check good. Re-install all connectors and relays.
If no other source for the problem can be found, refer to the Allison troubleshooting manual regarding TCM replacement.

svcsubproc.title: Exhaust Brake Circuits
svcsubproc.para: Problems with the exhaust brake circuits can be due to an inoperative exhaust brake switch, no output from the TCM to energize the exhaust brake relay, a defective relay, or open/shorted wires in the circuits. If no problems are found in the circuits on this chart the problem may be in the engine controller or circuits from the engine controller to the exhaust brake.

entry.para: Remove exhaust brake relay (3033). Turn key switch to ignition position. Measure the voltage between cavity 2 of the socket, circuit 13MC and ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13MC, then repair.
Bench test exhaust brake relay (3033) by measuring the resistance between pin 30 and 87A.
Bench test exhaust brake relay (3033) by measuring the resistance between pin 30 and 87, while applying 12 volts to pin 86 and ground to pin 85.
Disconnect gray TCM connector (3031) and install breakout box J 43799. Measure resistance from cavity 20, circuit 120 to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 120, then repair.
Turn key switch to ignition position. Place exhaust brake switch (3040) to on position. Measure the voltage between TCM connector (3031), cavity 7, circuit 107 and ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage through circuit 107, switch (3040) or circuit 13MB, then repair.
Exhaust brake relay and circuits to the TCM check good. Re-install all connectors and relays.
If no other source for the problem can be found, refer to the Allison troubleshooting manual regarding TCM replacement.
